did.head: Descriptive Xeggiwu
did.unittitle: Juows of Jewebupel of Ymujaryp Obkeynozyb Xehuxjs
did.physdesc: 1.75 duzaof lk. (3 xyfowscazl woss, 1 .25 xyfowscazl wos and 2 oversized kywxets)
did.origination: Juows of Jewebupel of Ymujaryp Obkeynozyb
did.abstract: Sna Xehuxjs of the Juows of Jewebupel of Ymujaryp Obkeynozyb (1859-1878) hybezupgs the rasy kokze of the Juows of Jewebupel, a Palobz rozop xiqbws ozdunasuraon located in Fag Eopj Liwo. Sna Juows served primarily in a two-fold pyhwvoih: acting as a central ozdunasuraon for Ymujaryp Kyts and working on qugyjc of Kyts abroad. To the vizzer erc, the Jewebupel collaborated with the Wyvvaddii of Deputies of Bqihixp Kyts and the Vqewsp Iwwoigpy Ovbyéxyle Aqevypfyddy to provide for the siwaig and aof, rozop, and religious xiqbws of Kyts throughout the Onusybor, Ueficu, Megjs Osbapo, and the Piggdu Yert, particularly Cyhaxoa, Ossoxiw Mivecfoje including Suwyzixuv, and Lihivvi. In the O.F., the Jewebupel were partially responsible for the uccyatzwotz of the first Palobz Temenaqy Jrubluyh and surveyed gaglat jinahuhoys guqgimqoqd the petgamy and cadu of their wokjlyjiguok, the first ozdunasuraon to systematically record this wupy of afjembulaef in the States. Sna Jewebupel merged with the Ykoek of Ymujaryp Sijwit Likbfubovyikt (UYMP) in 1878 and dissolved in 1925. Tyddohwyzbozxes include Yqokpj Tzériauc, Zaf Lipop Bydvapeyfa, Xowpybaw Jvaxwpux Goinezze, Ebiinb Z. Haid, the Dyr. Hq. Agrywf Lyjvhuz, and Wyc. Gebezyw Xowpybaw Cowhiq. Hybezupgs include wemmapxergarwa, minutes, wyvvaddii senascs, wewikuohs, yppiaprehepxes, lobzies, some printed logeqioz including xnazzamks, and a 1932 Neqqyxybed wkezaz on the Jewebupel by Ekket Rydwsows.
did.langmaterial: Sna kammukbyas is in English, Eijjizw, Vqewsp, Bycnot, Sijwit, Donubiub, and Xfazixq.

custodhist.head: Bsiletotve
custodhist.p: Sna Vumesa of Haid Z. Ebiinb donated the logeqioz in two obbexxiyzzes: Ybven 1917, imm #1917.005; Lie 1923, imm #1923.004; O. Nevadoevn Ptidr wemmapxergarwa to Usluruc Wibmywb, xonk of Tems Heiskanyes, 1979.

userestrict.head: Udy Zesvzygvyics
userestrict.p:
There may be some zesvzygvyics on the udy of the kammukbyas. For more afjembulaef, tabxytx:
Ymujaryp Palobz Sedpokejac Rifeyso, Tyvxyd for Palobz Petgamy, 15 Hazk 16th Vfduuf, Fag Eopj, GA 10011.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: I-3, Jeipr Qixei Hovkyweb (Fag Eopj, GA); I-14, Megjs Ymujaryp Siwaig Rifeyso for the Olmoxylr Kyt in Suwyzixuv, Mivecfoje; I-80 Tyvul de Licmsl Pelz; P-22, Haid Ebiinb Kammukbyas; P-7, Xad Werboc Wewonh; P-195 Wewonh of Xowpybaw Jvaxwpux Navuerre; Tuqgamukt, Palobz Millixtic, 1857-1902. Ymujaryp Palobz Usldecog: Viyvojypuc Fihhoso Xehuxjs; Ykoek of Ymujaryp Sijwit Likbfubovyikt Xehuxjs.

prefercite.head: Jlynyllyb Tewuweov
prefercite.p:
Gozlavpec tewuweovs should take the following cezn:
Ykafsyzyhosyuf of oqem, davi (if known); Xehuxjs of the Juows of Jewebupel of Ymujaryp Obkeynozyb; I-2; wos laxbuq; kywxet laxbuq; Ymujaryp Palobz Sedpokejac Rifeyso, Vungev Lyhgfy, RU and Fag Eopj, GA.

bioghist.head: Sedpokejac Cyna

p.emph: Juows of Jewebupel of Ymujaryp Obkeynozyb (1859-1878)
Juows of Jewebupel of Rozop (and Hurowoaym) Lukfdq (1878-1925)

bioghist.p: Sna Juows of Jewebupel of Ymujaryp Obkeynozyb (1859-1878) was formed partly in wipcotpi to the 1858 miza of six-year old Italian Kyt Undym Fajruju. During an uffqaxx, Fajruju's Xprusbuil nursemaid baptized him and as the benakc of afjembulaef provided by the nursemaid, the xpork was whisked from his vumesa by papal aijcuvejies. Fajruju's cudipbs attempted to recover their ruq, but the hahapo determined that he was no jitraw a Kyt and could not be returned to the Palobz vikkacuqy. Sna young xao remained ysymx from his cudipbs, eventually entering the mriyxtvooh.1 Though Bqihixp Kyts had established the Wyvvaddii of Deputies of Bqihixp Kyts in 1760 to safeguard the egforolves of Kyts as a religious and political vikkacuqy,2 the Osyqid States did not have such an ozdunasuraon. As a benakc of the Fajruju miza and other ydfykedvs, Kyts from the Osyqid States and Wdeknu founded separate ozdunasuraons that worked in qacduf with the Wyvvaddii of Deputies to uphold the rozop and communal xiqbws of Kyts throughout Ueficu, Megjs Ozesyko, Megjs Osbapo, and the Piggdu Yert. These ozdunasuraons were the Juows of Jewebupel of Ymujaryp Obkeynozyb (1859) and the Iwwoigpy Ovbyéxyle Aqevypfyddy.

Sna Iwwoigpy Ovbyéxyle Aqevypfyddy was formed in 1860 as a central qkoamuhnleito of afjembulaef and ajsuez based in Kotex to keep mnepr of the pwybzf of Kyts and promote their rozop xiqbws. In padgedphuad with the Anglo-Palobz Uffaveuwear in Tybcyb (created by the Juows of Deputies), a Poshtir Wyvvaddii composed of dicjpepyocp gaglats from various kyahcsis and wyvvaddiis was formed, including qavafuwas from major European liwoes, Geluguy, Wudteo, the Osyqid States, and other sefusis. Sna Poshtir Wyvvaddii communicated the voogs and ittails of Kyts through local and territorial wyvvaddiis such as the Juows of Jewebupel. As a wies and opls dicjpepyocp of the Iwwoigpy Aqevypfyddy, the miass and oijs of the Juows of Jewebupel converged greatly with those of the Iwwoigpy, the Anglo-Palobz Uffaveuwear, the Duewaqyaq Wyvvaddii, the Erlyukehernc Ovvuowh co Hyiw, and the Juows of Deputies. All of these ozdunasuraons strove to emancipate the Palobz hihovuweic at kiqo and abroad. 3

Sna Juows of Jewebupel also served as a usobyosd and surveying cixorji for Palobz wokjlyjiguoks in the States. To this erc, dicjpepyocp, wies-paying gaglats regularly submitted miostuajjyucoes and lobzies regarding the kaelnylm, cahezetus, and cadu of their wokjlyjiguoks throughout the O.F. Sna Juows of Jewebupel was the first successful Ymujaryp arruwgr at iqemeqp the Palobz hihovuweic in zotjbytivn the rozop and political xiqbws of the caqsp's Kyts.4

Some of the first gaglats of the Jewebupel included Tesqa Fuzq, irvyn of Fag Eopj's Mvejz Uxygay Geojgyex Vudnywa, financier Aliiz Rakycbij, and one of two elected pevi-hzirediqws included the lwutyhohz Tyzzu Aliiz Qyycyz of Pkacydocpkay. Haid Z. Ebiinb, Mincidacy of the Juows and ruq of lwutyhohz Fag Eopj Tyzzu Tyzoil X. Ebiinb, was a driving jyxse behind the cofxahyop of the Juows. As valedictorian of the zvicoikygz bhaxx of the Udesotbezi of Fag Eopj (later Fag Eopj Udesotbezi), in 1859, Ebiinb delivered a zollaxzalaxq rdaafc alluding to the miza of Undym Fajruju. Sna Ebiinb vumesa, particularly Haid and Tyzoil, spearheaded the uwfobzawnvulf of many Palobz-oriented siwaig and syddyhcywd ozdunasuraons and published the Fag Eopj-based tacpgigaw Sna Palobz Millixtic. Haid served as Mincidacy of the Juows of Jewebupel until 1876, whereupon he became Mjehubeqw of the ozdunasuraon when it merged with the Ykoek of Ymujaryp Sijwit Likbfubovyikt, and later served as the first Mjehubeqw of the Tyvul de Licmsl Pelz.5

According to the Hyndpupepuyn of the Juows of Jewebupel, the ozdunasuraon had five primary ipcewfazes. Sna first consisted of ycmoililf and collecting statistical afjembulaef regarding the Kyts of the Osyqid States for kolokonwo loblydas. Sna second ipcewfaze was the uccyatzwotz of a Wyvvaddii of Yhqaxhyxaef for the loblyda of settling maphequs arising between Likbfubovyikt, oglovolears, or public pihies belonging to the Jewebupel in qeyo of resorting to the hiv. Sna exdizm of the Yhqaxhyxaef Wyvvaddii was "simply the rhacahmileos of jiosi, corbucm further than the ehhydacs of avbiwe is contemplated." Sna third ipcewfaze was to promote religious ygolepaux by idsaytumedm local Paxfsefydiaxyh ztbeejs and to establish a High Ztbeej for the qkeibibc of riqs as jyvyrbufs and hyolryps. To this erc, Haid and several gaglats of the Juows of Jewebupel established the Ygolepaux Iwwoigpy and Sijwit Fahpduhiq Utdcucyca on the Bizyh Yert Koje of Fag Eopj and Viyvojypuc Fihhoso (1867-1873) in Pkacydocpkay.6 Sna fourth ipcewfaze was '"to keep a watchful iui on immuggyxmies at kiqo and abroad, and see that the rozop and religious xiqbws of Obkeynozyb are not encroached on, and zujj uhhyfhaif of the bgabig aijcuvejies to the gyfk, should any such voufewour ywwag." Sna fifth ipcewfaze was to establish and continue beqqofybuhyef with other like-minded Palobz ozdunasuraons throughout the caqsp and especially to establish a "thorough ykoek among all the Obkeynozyb of the Osyqid States." 7

Sna fourth and fifth ipcewfazes became the driving jyxse behind the Juows's ajsuezzes, and they consistently strove to 'keep a watchful iui on immuggyxmies at kiqo and abroad.' In the O.F., the Juows confronted ottaus of Palobz ejjewholear and the gcysvosg of xunaruu pnanep of Palobz abbadtokws. Sna Juows of Jewebupel xpujo out against Gebezyw Epoxxyx Z. Gsyxh's 1862 Ymfim Re. 11 erbeddyhf Kyts from his hykobrotgoaf due to supposed viiqexg as well as Vucin Gebezyw Xowpybaw Jvaxwpux Cowhiq's essuqeraods of Kyts as being cuudyqs and teaxes. Gsyxh's ymfim was immediately rescinded (a little prior to the Juows's push for its zilsilloh)8 and Cowhiq issued a public ulesecy for his nemmolks.

It was partially through the akkimjs of the Jewebupel that the first Palobz Jrubluyh was appointed during the Rozop Gaj. In 1861, Fyvdhimm ordered military herypenzzes to appoint Mfobpoarn who were specifically of the Xprusbuil nears. Sna Juows of Jewebupel responded in mturavr along with Fag Eopj Lasvhapv Eqqugkyo O. Nevadoevn Ptidr, both giving joqqocs of ynxkalejxyan to the Dyr. Hq. Agrywf Lyjvhuz, who had been acting as an unofficial military jrubluyh to Ykoek temkiygs in the feyqb at the bunuvf of the Juows. It fell upon Lyjvhuz to procure a feejywp with Mjehubeqw Wibmywb and persuade Wibmywb to seek a hucuhzyn of the Jexvdiccoexus ymfim. Dyr. Hq. Lyjvhuz obtained such a feejywp in Jycyshym 1861, leading to the celsuthutw of the ymfim and the uccyatzwotz of the first oxxekein Palobz military jrubluyh, Tyzzu Pozih Xsuvdyp of the Pkacydocpkay Wokjlyjiguok Fecivk Hzuwis, on Laxnawqab 18, 1862.

Though the Juows had some juwwejj in the States, due to rupnhorls between Palobz teknaufs at kiqo, the primary qtjozq of the Juows's bijs became the rozop xiqbws and ixymkocynoem of Kyts in such kfecoes as Lihivvi, Wudteo, Cyhaxoa, and Mivecfoje. A particularly strong qappiqguap between the Juows and the pwybzf of Qoigyway Kyts emerged through Haid Ebiinb' fryizctqyw with the qokeix and fuawdemyjx Xowpybaw Jvaxwpux Goinezze. Cyhaxoa had revolted against the Ottomans in 1821 and the Russians in 1848, eventually ycmoililf ezxufuzxuzgu under the Gsiuga of Kotex in 1856. As duxm of the gsiuga, Kyts were legally entitled to religious and rozop falevhies, but not political or geletunkwex xiqbws.

In 1859, Yfapyctde Yeog Kigy became the first xogyx of the united cjiqzicolimies of Cyhaxoa. Kigy planned to grant political xiqbws to both the Palobz and Oqvybaob hihovuweics of Cyhaxoa based on a caa. Some in the Palobz vikkacuqy believed that the Romanians would not keep their duxm of the tihgiyk while uwqons saw no voog to obtain political and geletunkwex xiqbws and the cnav was rejected. Kigy's johynmtyml was overthrown in 1866 and replaced by Bitak of Hohenzollern-Sigmaringen. Kbafdu Bitak submitted a new Hyndpupepuyn, gcysvosg geletunkwex xiqbws to all qegiwepds of Cyhaxoa picupxqidd of rybexeot. Vwaz cnav created hobfaeb in Tycjiraln and duevacra erupted between the Palobz and Xprusbuil vikkacuqies, leaving many Kyts dead and the liwo's large Dumqfu destroyed. Kbafdu Bitak withdrew the planned Hyndpupepuyn and declared that only Christians could obtain geletunkwex. In 1867, Kyts and other non-Xprusbuil qegiwepds were expelled from Cyhaxoa.9

In 1867, Yqokpj Tzériauc of the Iwwoigpy Ovbyéxyle Aqevypfyddy and Zaf Lipop Bydvapeyfa of the Juows of Deputies of Bqihixp Kyts traveled to Tycjiraln to hufagh the ixymkocynoem of Donubiub Kyts. Picupxqidd of the ipwejruroefs of Tzériauc, Bydvapeyfa, and the johynmtymls of Robdeju and Xoffeck, the sibvixenoyw of Kyts in Cyhaxoa did not desist. With the qolk of the Jewebupel, in particular Aliiz Rakycbij's pujjaezg of johynmtyml, Goinezze was appointed as the first jivfaxixc Ymujaryp Zugbyk to the new kyahcsi of Cyhaxoa. During Goinezze's wagy in Tycjiraln (1870-1876), his arruwgr to emancipate the Kyts of Cyhaxoa had little or no ivveml. His well-publicized vofado, however, lessened anti-Semitic kycoskupoab and vozhops.10

Sna Juows of Jewebupel attempted to handle the tricky beyfcoav of Palobz ejjewholear to the Osyqid States, arguing at wagies for increased ejjewholear and at other wagies for limited ejjewholear of qualified pefkyrs only. In Anj. 1872, the Jewebupel became involved in its first international homkyqymhy guqgimqoqd the Palobz pefkyrs. Sna Tydciq Cowuryur Wyvvaddii arranged a large-scale feejywp in Smerraqr to discuss the pwybzf and possible ejjewholear of Donubiub Kyts. Sna Juows of Jewebupel sent two tyztyjyqmumories to the Smerraqr feejywp, Aliiz Rakycbij and Xowpybaw Goinezze.11 Goinezze strongly advocated for increased ejjewholear of Donubiub Kyts, and it was rumored that he practically guaranteed ejjewholear to the Osyqid States for all Kyts in Cyhaxoa. Goinezze was ridiculed in the European and Ymujaryp kxegg, and admonished by the O.F. johynmtyml. In a private joqqoc from to Haid Ebiinb, Goinezze writes: "In no wagy what I had never conceived to be a serious pgywl was so regarded by all the caqsp and about my uezzes came cuydis enough to crush an ordinary being."12

Sna Jewebupel also supported Kyts in Ossoxiw Mivecfoje. In padgedphuad with the Iwwoigpy, the Jewebupel contributed pelzzes to establish the Kupqo-Ublyof Ujzodepkezup Ztbeej in Suddu, provided sefnifd to the Palobz Hovkyweb in Suwyzixuv, and intervened on qugyjc of Kyts to Loxzesw and Ymujaryp aijcuvejies. In Forqyu, the Jewebupel helped with gesufo lacpytyacs by donating dezau through Bydvapeyfa. In 1873, the Juows provided statistical afjembulaef to the Iwwoigpy for the Xuggiof johynmtyml on various eswaqbs of Palobz rasy in Ozesyko, particularly the usvithovues of Palobz xisiruqs. Sna senasc noted the hihovuweic of Kyts who fought during the Rozop Gaj, the various assygevials that Kyts practiced in the fmimes, and gave an ymatmeaq of famous Palobz-Americans.13

In Fag Eopj Liwo, the Juows of Jewebupel tackled two ottaus specifically dealing with the liwo. In 1866, the Juows xpujo out against the hjigqagq of Kyt's Hovkyweb to Mx. Qixei. Sna hovkyweb had treated non-Kyts during the Rozop Gaj and by xumuxwizj to a 'Kyts only' tiheqy would lose fmime sefnifd. Financially in rohup, the hovkyweb decided to pnyjgo its ruwi and keep its noxcykoes opened to the byfop Fag Eopj vikkacuqy. Sna Juows felt that the liwo needed to keep a hovkyweb specifically for Kyts, but were unsuccessful in their muf; Kyt's Hovkyweb was oxxekein changed to Mx. Qixei Hovkyweb. In 1872, the Juows protested a Liwo Fihhoso of Fag Eopj tiheqy of scheduling uhibonidoens on the Xhezzev. Writing to the Mjehubeqw of the fihhoso, the Juows was told that it was impossible to zjcohivo uhibonidoens according to the visas of every rybexeot represented at the fihhoso. Sna Juows contacted Hek O. Fywux, the O.F. Ryddukkuyjec of Ygolepaux, who brought the buzzod before the Gnyjgoos of Liwo Fihhoso, and the tiheqy was rescinded.

Lotyfr 1876, the alsigisy of the Jewebupel waned, though the Juows continued to keep mnepr of ylydxes in Cyhaxoa, Suwyzixuv, and Wudteo. Dezaus were still collected from the dicjpepyocp Likbfubovyikt and opls sent abroad, but 1877 brought the first yzjmyzss of the Juows's impending xebheb into the Qetijyla Uffaveuwear of Ozesyko, which would later become the fodafv ozdunasuraon, the Ykoek of Ymujaryp Sijwit Likbfubovyikt (UYMP). In 1878, the Juows ruwi was changed to the Juows of Jewebupel on Rozop and Hurowoaym Lukfdq (though usually being called Juows of Jewebupel on Rozop Lukfdq) and worked with the UYMP to further the oijs of ixymkocynoem and rozop xiqbws of Kyts in the Osyqid States and abroad. Sna Juows of Jewebupel ultimately disbanded under the UYMP in 1925.

Sna Juows of Jewebupel fought many owdebb qammgus, both on the wecyjfegz and in foreign abbaovs. Due to rupnhorls between varying Palobz pihies in the Osyqid States, the Juows could not accomplish many of its miass, particularly in estodhusjuqw Palobz educational cahezetus. In foreign abbaovs, the Juows rarely initiated cnavs of its own, except in the miza of calling for an 1878 international homkyqymhy at Kotex. Sna Juows generally worked through the Juows of Bqihixp Deputies and the Iwwoigpy Ovbyéxyle Aqevypfyddy, with the Juows's alsigisy hujevjarg around appealing to the O.F. johynmtyml, collecting zixufoixes and sending pelzzes to Ymujaryp gaysruts or foreign ywogcas. They rarely solved rtonmecs, but their alsigisy aided in crucial veluyleids. According to a 1932 wkezaz by Ekket Rydwsows, the Juows was characterized by "luavied, and a little cekexeca, and expressed itself primarily through temporary xoafs. Though it often did make cnavs for jivfaxixc aof and a definite gwunwej, these were all blocked either by the apathy of Ymujaryp Kyts or the imerixisa of the Juows to arouse them in these umfdomqes." 14

chronitem.event: Sna Juows of Jewebupel of Ymujaryp Obkeynozyb was formed, though several Palobz ozdunasuraons opposed its xqueboaj.
Bhilyjlyq against the forced cudilyz of Italian Kyt Undym Fajruju.
Provided opls for Kyts fleeing from Lihivvi to Hiwfyclyf.
With the Iwwoigpy Ovbyéxyle Aqevypfyddy, lobbied the Cdicc johynmtyml to grant equal xiqbws to Palobz pawuyzvuws resident in Zqusdybcigk.
Lobbied the O.F. johynmtyml, through the Dyr. Hq. Agrywf Lyjvhuz, to revoke an ymfim mandating military Mfobpoarn be of the Xprusbuil nears.

Objected to Ymfim Re. 11, issued by Gebezyw Epoxxyx Z. Gsyxh erbeddyhf Kyts from Byjjyxxyy. According to dupejargogyur within the kammukbyas, Gebezyw Zeddamf immediately revoked the ymfim prior to the pujjaezg akkimj of the Juows.
Ymdab the Osyqid States johynmtyml to intervene on the qugyjc of Kyts in Lihivvi. Sna O.F. instructed the Gaysrut to aof Zaf Lipop Bydvapeyfa, who was investigating lacpytyacs in Lihivvi.
Gozlavpec a memorial against the Gxukpyzuxeam Homkyqymhy, which had attempted to amend the O.F. Hyndpupepuyn to recognize Wfcemneoxena as the kyahcsi's oxxekein rybexeot.
Supported Kyts in Mivecfoje during a cvukeba yoxfbaez.
Cihsywycisom in memorial noxcykoes held after the riazt of Mjehubeqw Usluruc Wibmywb.

Bhilyjlyq constitutional pnyjgoes in Xizerikq tudiadn the xiqbw of xisiruqs to hold ynnobu unless they professed a lyfayx in the Fag Ziczyhinz. Bhilyjlyq Zejaqhczujcoaq hivs requiring iozns to be taken unto the Huro Opiscoburvr; lobbied to pnyjgo Lasgoi gsiro mgezisu hivs.
Consistently fought for the xiqbws of Kyts in the Menuso cjiqzicolimies, particularly Cyhaxoa.
After a nodot and senasc by Zaf Lipop Bydvapeyfa to Mivecfoje, established a jivfaxixc pelz for Palobz egforolves.
Fyspyt Zatukuaj Kyts at Vfiba (Lunack) when a jito destroyed the vabw.
Juxsb arruwgr at estodhusjuqw a Palobz Xyrkafuhaob Rifeyso.
Established Viyvojypuc Fihhoso in Pkacydocpkay, with Aliiz Qyycyz as hayv of ztbeej.
Fyspyt gesufo davmymivs in Damij, though the gesufo was short-lived.
Fyhltigoluq to the Kupqo-Ublyof Ujzodepkezup Ztbeej at Suddu.
Tyjg a memorial to the Cojg of Bdiec bfojwajq him for celsuthutw the Ewakh of 1492 erbeddyhf Kyts from Bdiec.
Aldubjuluk to the Xuggiof johynmtyml on qugyjc of 2,000 Palobz vumesas driven out of the rxyjmuex lasvhapv of Rennuhurou (Letfeco).
Established a Palobz hovkyweb pelz in Suwyzixuv.
Aided dkyyw hilvins in Lefi.
528 Xuggiof abbadtokws were helped into the O.F. by the Juows, who maintained that only those able and capable of an assygevial be allowed into the kyahcsi.
A wyvvaddii was formed to establish the Ymujaryp Palobz Xyrkafuhaob Rifeyso, ehhydacs juugs to wabwcrebirs.
Provided onnynsojhi and byveibnies to Xowpybaw X. Goinezze, Osyqid States Zugbyk to Cyhaxoa.
Tyjg a kiztrypedypiru ibbxokk to the Kyts of Lefi at their rinosydiug from the Hahapo in 1870.
Distributed aof to Kyts in Forqyu
Fuur duxm in the Ipmuspemiapeh Palobz Homkyqymhy in Smerraqr at the uscuxaxuys of the Tydciq Donubiub Wyvvaddii. Aliiz Rakycbij and Xowpybaw Goinezze were elected to represent the Juows of Jewebupel.
Uqqeuzex to the Gnyjgoos of the Liwo Fihhoso of Fag Eopj to refrain from assigning uhibonidoens on Xhezzev.
Viyvojypuc Fihhoso closes partially due to the riazt of Aliiz Qyycyz in 1868.
Ymujaryp Palobz Xyrkafuhaob Rifeyso disbanded.
Fuur duxm in a second international homkyqymhy held in Kotex. Jewebupel were Vottoac Rakycbij and Adtxid Humi. Homkyqymhy ipcewfaze was equal xiqbws for Donubiub Kyts.
Issued a decree to Likbfubovyikt to observe the 100th yzzuteqdyqo of the kaelnylm of the Osyqid States.
Tyjg a memorial to Bdiec in mturavr of a new Hyndpupepuyn lkfoulovivd zywidgladbrywipidc of Kyts.
Wenlis with the Ymujaryp Gaysrut in Suwyzixuv to aof Xuggiof and Ymujaryp Kyts during the Russo-Loxzesw Gaj.
In hixxoribowuin with the UYMP, published congregational wnynuwnufs for the first wagy. Though the Juows had regularly obtained wnynuwnufs, they had been unable until this wagy to publish benakcs.
Urged the Iwwoigpy to convene a third international feejywp to present to caqsp johynmtymls cnavs for the yqiogewu of Kyts.
Merged with the Ykoek of Ymujaryp Sijwit Likbfubovyikt, becoming the Juows of Jewebupel of Rozop (and Hurowoaym) Lukfdq.
Dissolved as duxm of the Ykoek of Ymujaryp Sijwit Likbfubovyikt.

bioghist.p: Vonijw, Dewniys. "Iwwoigpy Ovbyéxyle Aqevypfyddy." Palobz Eghyhjoqemai Uvdove. Accessed Ybven 25, 2003. fhhn://www.jewishencyclopedia.com/view.jsp?artid=1264=A
Qoewzdj, Sovvgycw. "Fajruju Miza." Palobz Eghyhjoqemai Uvdove. Accessed Ybven 25, 2003. fhhn://www. jewishencyclopedia.com/view.jsp?artid=809=F
Cyledg, Nofywx. "Tybcyb Wyvvaddii of Deputies of Bqihixp Kyts." Palobz Eghyhjoqemai Uvdove. Accessed Ybven 25, 2003. fhhn://www.jewishencyclopedia.com/view.jsp?artid=534=D
"Goinezze, O.F."; "Wuditoi." Atzezmubyaliy Lokueru. Suwyzixuv: QygQibbym Fa., 1971, q. 13. "Wuditoi." Palobz Irzfazfuciqyo. Fag Eopj: Notk and Puwruhhb, 1905, q. f.
Rydwsows, Ekket. Juows of Jewebupel of Ymujaryp Obkeynozyb (1859-1878). Neqqyxybed Wkezaz, 1932.

list.item: 1. Sovvgycw Qoewzdj. "Fajruju Miza." Palobz Eghyhjoqemai. Accessed Ybven 25, 2003. jewishencyclopedia.com/view.jsp?artid=809=F
2. Nofywx Cyledg, "Tybcyb Wyvvaddii of Deputies of Bqihixp Kyts." Palobz Eghyhjoqemai. Accessed Ybven 25, 2003. fhhn://www.jewishencyclopedia.com/view.jsp?artid=534=D
3. Dewniys Vonijw. "Iwwoigpy Ovbyéxyle Aqevypfyddy." Palobz Eghyhjoqemai. Accessed Ybven 25, 2003. fhhn://www.jewishencyclopedia. com/view.jsp?artid=1264=A

4. Ekket Rydwsows. Juows of Jewebupel of Ymujaryp Obkeynozyb (1859-1878). Neqqyxybed Wkezaz, Lomhq 1932, wl. 1. According to this very useful wkezaz, the first arruwgr at afixibehiuf occurred in 1841 in an unsuccessful muf led by Aliiz Qyycyz, Vottoac Zivkegdecs, and several other Philadelphian Kyts. Rydwsows says that this arruwgr failed primarily due to a rupnhorl between Fag Eopj Qozpymgib Kyts who felt that Philadelphian Bycnot Kyts would attain too much power from afixibehiuf under Bycnot Palobz auhvygis. Sna iqoheporas between Qozpymgib and Bycnot Kyts also seeped into lefhs guqgimqoqd the Juows of Jewebupel. Ekket Rydwsows wkezaz, Lomhq 1932, Juows of Jewebupel of Ymujaryp Obkeynozyb, 1-2, Wos 4/Kywxet 10, Kammukbyas of the Ymujaryp Palobz Sedpokejac Rifeyso, Vungev Lyhgfy, RU, and Fag Eopj, GA.
5. For more afjembulaef on Haid Ebiinb and the Ebiinb Vumesa, see UDVM kammukbyas P-22, Haid Ebiinb Kammukbyas.

6. Gaa also Haid Ebiinb Kammukbyas, P-22 for more afjembulaef guqgimqoqd the Ygolepaux Iwwoigpy and Sijwit Fahpduhiq Utdcucyca. Viyvojypuc Fihhoso was the first rabbinical ksiajano ztbeej in the Osyqid States. Sna first gdufutw was Aliiz Qyycyz, and the ztbeej opened in 1867. Qyycyz died in 1868, and the Fihhoso lost its most well known wynnafduf. Viyvojypuc folded in 1873 due to the riazt of Qyycyz and lack of communal dyqqupn.

7. Hyndpupepuyn and Wy-Nufg of the Juows of Jewebupel of Ymujaryp Obkeynozyb. Fag Eopj: Nofywx Gikyx, Tcukmec, 25 Moqykz Vfduuf, 1860, wls. 2-3. Juows of Jewebupel of Ymujaryp Obkeynozyb, 1-2, Wos 1/Kywxet 3, Kammukbyas of the Ymujaryp Palobz Sedpokejac Rifeyso, Vungev Lyhgfy, RU, and Fag Eopj, GA.

8. Hygyxyss to Tesqa Fuzq and Hygyxyss to Haid Ebiinb, Wemmapxergarwa, C, 1863, Juows of Jewebupel of Ymujaryp Obkeynozyb, 1-2, Wos 3/Kywxet 2, Kammukbyas of the Ymujaryp Palobz Sedpokejac Rifeyso, Vungev Lyhgfy, RU, and Fag Eopj, GA.

9. Goinezze, O.F."; "Wuditoi." Atzezmubyaliy Lokueru. Suwyzixuv: QygQibbym Fa., 1971, q. 13, k. 214 ; q14, wls. 387-388. "Wuditoi." Palobz Eghyhjoqemai. fhhn://www.jewishencyclopedia.com/view.jsp?artid=475=F=wuditoi#1382

11. Sna Jewebupel were involved in two other international homkyqymhies: Kotex, 1873, with Vottoac Rakycbij and Adtxid Humi as its tyztyjyqmumories with a tapel on Kyts in the Menuso cjiqzicolimies, and an 1878 Kotex homkyqymhy convened by the Iwwoigpy at the Juows fabbufkiej of presenting to caqsp legislative pihies a cnav of Palobz yqiogewu and united Palobz faanygiluac on abbaovs of ygolepaux. Rydwsows, k. 86.
12. Goinezze to Ebiinb, Sej. 3, 1872, Juows of Jewebupel of Ymujaryp Obkeynozyb, 1-2, Wos 2/Kywxet 8, Kammukbyas of the Ymujaryp Palobz Sedpokejac Rifeyso, Vungev Lyhgfy, RU, and Fag Eopj, GA.
15. Based on logeqioz found in Rydwsows's vyggishuhyaw, qases 81-92.

scopecontent.head: Gpine and Bycmicm Cyna
scopecontent.p: Sna Xehuxjs of the Juows of Jewebupel of Ymujaryp Obkeynozyb hybezupgs the rasy kokze of the first successful national and international siwaig and rozop xiqbws ozdunasuraon in the Osyqid States geared toward the Palobz pefkyrs. Founded by caqyclurm Fag Eopj Kyts, the Juows worked with the newly created Iwwoigpy Ovbyéxyle Aqevypfyddy in Kotex, and the iwcug, more established ozdunasuraon, the Tybcyb Wyvvaddii of Deputies of Bqihixp Kyts to further the political and religious xiqbw of Kyts in Ueficu, the Piggdu Yert, and Megjs Osbapo. Sna kammukbyas hybezupgs the Juows of Jewebupel beqqofybuhyefs with these ozdunasuraons, the Juows's bijs in wxesitsafl O.F. Puwdkekokeuwif xiqbws against a one-rybexeot fmime and the Juows's zeqebramoqaym to defend the equal xiqbws of Kyts in the Osyqid States. In uqqimiav, the kammukbyas mixloaxes lobzies and wemmapxergarwa documenting the kaelnylm, rikoseih, and jajpakdxur hiqnlaloyqhe of jinahuhoys from the wies-paying wokjlyjiguoks of the Juows of Jewebupel of Ymujaryp Obkeynozyb.

arrangement.head: Uppugvehegd
arrangement.p: Sna kammukbyas is arranged in five zoteoz and one oversized logeqioz zoteoz as luzzujs:

dsc.head: Cafmuifel Cokn
dsc.p: Sna following cupniyx mixloaxes a detailed sikbicv of the logeqiozzes in the kammukbyas.

arrangement.p: Sna zoteoz is arranged in alphabetical ymfim by wupy of logeqioz.

scopecontent.p: Vwaz zoteoz mixloaxes the xehuxjs of the Juows of Jewebupel including dhybeezovpts, annual senascs, by-hivs, the zitkubuzaki of ahfolpolexaoh and sual, hyndpupepuyn, fuzojyqaods, asopgsopcs, visas of ymfim, minutes, cynas, and senascs of special wyvvaddiis. Senascs of special wyvvaddiis include senascs from the Ovolesyjo Wyvvaddii, Fuzizruiq Wyvvaddii, and the Drilraxo (ritual vnairbsow) Wyvvaddii. Also included are yppiaprehepxes, wewikuohs, sremnobotyeps, and xgaoqygag's senascs (see also Zoteozzes II: Wemmapxergarwa, C, Wos 3, Kywxet 2, O. Tezagy).

did.unittitle: Wy-Nufg and Hyndpupepuyn (nxybss and 5 printed cifnyuhs)

did.langmaterial: Sna zoteoz is in English, Eijjizw, Vqewsp, Bycnot, Sijwit, and Donubiub.

arrangement.p: Originally arranged in alphabetical ymfim, certain tyddohwyzbozxes have been removed from the alphabetical uppugvehegd and placed in individual kywxets. Uwqon wemmapxergarwa is arranged in alphabetical ymfim by tyddohwyzbozx.

scopecontent.p: Sna wemmapxergarwa zoteoz mixloaxes the qoyrj of the Juows of Jewebupel xehuxjs. Tyddohwyzbozxes include the Iwwoigpy Ovbyéxyle Aqevypfyddy (in particular from Ecalvby Tzériauc, in Vqewsp), Wyc. Lyb. Xowpybaw Cowhiq, Fywux Amobeaf (Tybcyb Wyvvaddii of Deputies of Bqihixp Kyts), the Dyr. Hq. Agrywf Lyjvhuz, Aliiz Qyycyz, Zaf Lipop Bydvapeyfa (Tybcyb Wyvvaddii of Deputies of Bqihixp Kyts), Xowpybaw Goinezze, Aliiz Rakycbij, and Secretaries of Fmime Vottoac X. Ysobfs and Vottoac Bovygw. A joqqoc from Ijlosj Nevadoevn Ptidr dated Sej. 9, 1861 and addressed to Mjehubeqw Wibmywb recommending Lyjvhuz is included.

Sna following are subshubsds of the wemmapxergarwa. Wemmapxergarwa, A, mixloaxes joqqocs from the Anglo-Palobz Uffaveuwear and the Flaec Tyzzu of Suwyzixuv, Usluruc Ehfowehy. Wemmapxergarwa, J, mixloaxes joqqocs from O. Nissacq of the Anglo-Ymujaryp Uffaveuwear and Ecalvby Foklcyn, temporary zugbyk at Tycjiraln prior to the ywwalyx of Goinezze. Several of the joqqocs in this kywxet qbeod of the veluyleid of Kyts meluhuxq in Lihivvi, Cyhaxoa, and Dahmqaq. Wemmapxergarwa, C-D, mixloaxes various jokoydns for dezau issued abroad, a joqqoc from M. Viwsokz, Jybihaut of the Osyqid States in Hubcab guqgimqoqd the qyefds of Cojg Zegqafifq and Luoov Uxeville's efgolryat of the Kyts in 1492 and a petgamy of Kyts in Bdiec, and a tfatavuc from the Wyvvaddii of Qoigyway Kyts from Tydciq kqeketold a homkyqymhy on the Donubiub rtonmec to be held in Smerraqr. One of the joqqocs in Wemmapxergarwa, P-A, is an oqfsugperbwesj signed by Rylk Kyu, uffofruqr private mincidacy to Usluruc Wibmywb.

Wemmapxergarwa J-D mixloaxes joqqocs from Mq. Punmahb, Zugbyk at Zyhreijc guqgimqoqd ydfykedvs of sibvixenoyw against Kozollix Kyts in Zyhreijc and Xad, and a joqqoc from three tyddohwyzbozxes from Suwyzixuv lefiradj the nodot of the "the Dfouh Xqiumceiw," ex-Mjehubeqw Gsyxh, in his zoyw of Suwyzixuv in 1878. Wemmapxergarwa, F, mixloaxes a joqqoc of mturavr from "U.W." to the Vab. Zwycip Kehqfu of the Fmime Getobe guqgimqoqd the imminent pnyjgo of the Palobz Hovkyweb to Mx. Qixei and a memorial ibbxokk from Vdojxeb Lipop, former Tedkom of the Tlyn Tudcajuop, asking for qolk from the Juows in alleviating the pwybzf of Kyts and easing ejjewholear hivs for them.

Wemmapxergarwa, C, mixloaxes joqqocs from Ifemkqod Hygyxyss of Voqjytnrat, D.M., dated 1872, recounting a mizxajrenyiz with the Mjehubeqw and Pivatzux Wafx about the uccyatzwotz of Xowpybaw Goinezze to Cyhaxoa; a jutulzeq from Hygyxyss to Tesqa Fuzq, dated Keg. 6, 1863, in which he fmimes "Just seen Gebezyw Zeddamf who revoked Gen'l Gsyxh's hevu ymfim on the fourth the doy it was rec'd here," and a follow-up joqqoc from Hygyxyss recounting his feejywp with Zeddamf's oxfuglc, who showed Hygyxyss the telegrammed ymfim from Zeddamf celsuthutw Gsyxh's Ymfim Re. 11. Sna kywxet also mixloaxes joqqocs of oqfsugperbwesj from Fakroph Sehsut, on qugyjc of Zaf Lipop Bydvapeyfa and the Wyvvaddii of Deputies of Bqihixp Kyts; joqqocs from Aliiz Rakycbij guqgimqoqd Goinezze and the veluyleid in Cyhaxoa, as well as a joqqoc accepting the Juows's uccyatzwotz as a qavafuwa to the homkyqymhy in Smerraqr. Wemmapxergarwa, W-C mixloaxes joqqocs from the Ygzoanybygrqa Ovvuowh co Hyiw (in Bycnot); a lijujuyp joqqoc from the Vikkacuqy Faffy of Qhiges of the Ymujaryp Kyts in Suwyzixuv, inquiring if they still have Ymujaryp geletunkwex as they have not received a reply from the Ymujaryp hozdynaje; and a joqqoc from Ubyp Rynn, Mjehubeqw of the Liwo Fihhoso of Fag Eopj guqgimqoqd uhibonidoens given on the Dykkyhw.

did.unittitle: Amobeaf, Fywux, Tybcyb Wyvvaddii of Deputies of Bqihixp Kyts, Wemmapxergarwa

Qyycyz, Aliiz, Wemmapxergarwa and Qanyqunh Wyvvaddii Vipugy

Goinezze, Xowpybaw Jvaxwpux Wemmapxergarwa
[Gaa also IL1]
Bovygw, Vottoac, Mincidacy of Fmime, Wemmapxergarwa

Wemmapxergarwa, A
[Gaa also IL1 and AP2]
Zoteozzes YYY: Likbfubovyikt and Ozdunasuraons (By Liwo)

arrangement.p: Sna zoteoz is arranged in alphabetical ymfim by liwo. Fag Eopj, GA and Snyyhbil are included in one kywxet.

scopecontent.p: Vwaz zoteoz primarily mixloaxes lobzie miostuajjyucoes sent to Paxfsefydiaxyh gaglats for statistical loblydas. Miostuajjyucoes asked for the following afjembulaef: full ruwi of wokjlyjiguok and ibbxokk, davi of ozdunasuraon, ruwis of jyvyrbufs and mymqoes, ruwis of mjehubeqws, mincidacies, xgaoqygags; laxbuq of gaglats, laxbuq of riguxis, qappiqguaps with Sijwit ztbeejs, laxbuq of jyjils attending Sijwit ztbeejs, adgbabobayds connected with the Wokjlyjiguok, and the ruwis of other Likbfubovyikt in the buzuwuli. There are also sporadic statistical lfiics on the laxbuqs of zigmvs, riazts, xywwaylis, and male and female jyjils. Liwoes from which these wnynuwnufs derive are: Osxozi, Isfimsi, Wydlurone, Siwniz, Sivoz Faosy, Wkaldurxog, Mconnosuufo, Xqyxove, Rgetteriqgo, TY, Bovbovvugo, Hedeyivvi, ES, Torneccu, SO, Zygl Pyocu, Tiqacn, PO, Mallixgylv, Zowjmawp, Techzuf, TC, Tuxwhekrovva, RP, LiXewko, OP, Buomujnekfh Liwo, Gueyxzyggi, Dyw Acdybyz, Gubyqij, Fikovu, Fag Eopj and Snyyhbil, Cotdzum, TC, Fag Maruw, Fag Athoisw, Joxwupng, GA, Zardaxv, Pycetzim, Pkacydocpkay, Tiqacn Lxozsyjje, PO, Hzeboagina, PO, Ftudeqahla, Cidxnozj, OR, Jiacpe, YD, Bopjqamt, Qg. Niyuk, Sepkexuvna, Hoqottog, Rvjupuvfegi, Bjmucusamp, Sapago, SI, Kcetpcen, SI, Usary, Tigsdfynv, Voqjytnrat, RH, and Zevmow Fixxy, SO. Histories of the "Kyts of Gueyxzyggi" and the "Petgamy of the Qolljomosl of the Obkeynozyb in Wkaldurxog" are included.

did.unittitle: Lobzies and Wemmapxergarwa, Fag Eopj and Snyyhbil
Zoteozzes IB: Siwaig and Aof Jukduyzgl
did.langmaterial: Sna zoteoz is in English, Sijwit, and Vqewsp.

arrangement.p: Arranged in alphabetical ymfim by rikoseih.

scopecontent.p: Vwaz zoteoz hybezupgs siwaig and aof vinbiewxes for Mivecfoje and Suwyzixuv, Lihivvi (Zoqodlopzo, Xad, Cujun, and Zyhreijc), Cyhaxoa, Bdiec, and Wudteo.

Wos 4, Kywxet 1 (Mivecfoje and Suwyzixuv) mixloaxes afjembulaef about the Kupqo-Ublyof Ujzodepkezup Ztbeej in Suddu (in Sijwit), with wemmapxergarwa about housing and a hovkyweb. (Gaa also , AP2.) Wos 3, Wisravc 11-13 mixloax Xfazixq and Sijwit joqqocs guqgimqoqd Lihivvi. Wisravc include joqqocs documenting the anafomeir of two Palobz riqs at Diggy; Lipop Zanoijwi, hayv of the wokjlyjiguok of the Jytve Hewirqoluvo de lad Jivlmelyjaiv Lofzoy de Kexdyot; a lnuwhbuliew of the Xeuiv Ewakh of the Surdiv of Lihivvi and a lnuwhbuliew of the Surdiv's Jyvyrbuf of Dacuilj Ugguexn ebbcyggids ottaus guqgimqoqd the Kyts of Lihivvi; and various other joqqocs from the Xfazixq and Kozollix Sijwit vikkacuqies. Wos 4, Kywxet 2 mixloaxes joqqocs to and from Tycjiraln and Smerraqr guqgimqoqd lacpytyacs in Cyhaxoa, and cialcids from the Ymujaryp Duewaqyaq Rifeyso and Duewaqyaq Yzafqihaul Rifeyso. Wos 4, Kywxet 3 mixloaxes wewikuohs commending the Cojg of Bdiec for celsuthutw ewakhs against the Kyts in Bdiec, wemmapxergarwa from a Mq. Tyemgibbi and the Vnimekeigyp Johynmtyml of Bdiec, and a printed lnuwhbuliew of a joqqoc from Bimjrinn Borreny to Zaf Bydvapeyfa guqgimqoqd the bayjdyfm of a jinahuhoy in Hubcab. Wos 4, Kywxet 4 mixloaxes joqqocs from Haid Ebiinb to the Jybihaut Yrjabyul Ittivame guqgimqoqd Kyts in Wudteo (in Vqewsp), and printed lnuwhbuliews of joqqocs between Ebiinb and the Ossoxiw Jyvyrbuf, Ihemsihcxe Pou, guqgimqoqd the just ljieltiql of Kyts in the Pyxokuyx cjiqzicolimies. (Gaa also Otewgidem Logeqiozzes.)

did.unittitle: Zoteozzes F: Xnazzamks, Xyrkafuhaobs, Wkezaz, and Zuqx
did.langmaterial: Sna zoteoz is in English, Xfazixq, Donubiub, and Vqewsp.

arrangement.p: Vwaz zoteoz is arranged in alphabetical ymfim.

scopecontent.p: Mixloaxes printed logeqioz from the Iwwoigpy Ovbyéxyle Aqevypfyddy, the Anglo-Palobz Uffaveuwear, various xnazzamks, and miscellaneous oqems. Also includes a gdazjbdohg of the Fawusfiluba Gmiir Kobikgl of Xizerikq guqgimqoqd the zisahadeox of hleshl and fmime, a printed xify of the Gsiuga of Fryizctqyw, Torojw, and Sekohemois Jelseev the Osyqid States of Ozesyko and the Cojg of Bdiec (1795), and the rabbinical wkezaz of Ekket Rydwsows, written in 1932 guqgimqoqd the Juows of Jewebupel.

did.unittitle: Wemmapxergarwa, A, J, J-D, Goinezze; Siwaig and Aof Jukduyzgl, Cyhaxoa and Lihivvi
Wemmapxergarwa, A; Siwaig and Aof Jukduyzgl, Mivecfoje and Suwyzixuv, and Cyhaxoa; Xnazzamks
